response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (21 years old)", "medium", "Age is in early adulthood where risk can be variable; not extremely high risk by itself."),
    ("Gender (Male)", "medium", "Males tend to have a slightly higher risk profile but this factor by itself is not decisive."),
    ("Race (Black)", "medium", "Race can correlate with socioeconomic factors; however, it does not automatically imply higher recidivism risk in these cases."),
    ("Arrest History (1 arrest with conviction)", "medium", "A single arrest with conviction shows some interaction with the criminal justice system, though not as high as multiple arrests."),
    ("Physical Characteristics (5'9\", 150-174 lbs)", "low", "These measurements are within normal ranges and do not materially contribute to risk."),
    ("Marital Status (Never married)", "medium", "Never being married can sometimes be associated with reduced stability, though it is not a strong predictor on its own."),
    ("Living Arrangement (Not living alone)", "low", "Living with others generally provides a supportive environment, which reduces risk."),
    ("Education (No high school diploma/GED)", "high", "Lack of educational attainment is a significant risk factor as indicated in previous examples."),
    ("Employment (Held no jobs during the year)", "high", "No employment is a strong risk factor associated with recidivism."),
    ("Drug Use (Used drugs in past four years – marijuana)", "medium", "Drug use indicates a potential for risk, though limited to marijuana here."),
    ("Depression (Feels down most of the time)", "high", "Chronic feelings of depression are a strong indicator of distress and have been associated with higher recidivism in examples."),
    ("Family Household (Lived with biological mother, household size 5, rural area)", "medium", "A rural upbringing may involve less exposure to urban crime, but the overall household setup gives moderate risk."),
    ("Religious Belief (Believes that God has nothing to do with what happens to him)", "medium", "A lack of religious or spiritual support can remove a potential protective factor, moderately increasing risk")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Age is in early adulthood where risk can be variable; not extremely high risk by itself.
Males tend to have a slightly higher risk profile but this factor by itself is not decisive.
Race can correlate with socioeconomic factors; however, it does not automatically imply higher recidivism risk in these cases.
A single arrest with conviction shows some interaction with the criminal justice system, though not as high as multiple arrests.
These measurements are within normal ranges and do not materially contribute to risk.
Never being married can sometimes be associated with reduced stability, though it is not a strong predictor on its own.
Living with others generally provides a supportive environment, which reduces risk.
Lack of educational attainment is a significant risk factor as indicated in previous examples.
Employment (Held no jobs during the year)
No employment is a strong risk factor associated with recidivism.
Drug Use (Used drugs in past four years – marijuana)
Drug use indicates a potential for risk, though limited to marijuana here.
Depression (Feels down most of the time)
Chronic feelings of depression are a strong indicator of distress and have been associated with higher recidivism in examples.
Family Household (Lived with biological mother, household size 5, rural area)
A rural upbringing may involve less exposure to urban crime, but the overall household setup gives moderate risk.
Religious Belief (Believes that God has nothing to do with what happens to him)
A lack of religious or spiritual support can remove a potential protective factor, moderately increasing risk

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. First,analyze the following example cases of risk factors and resulting 3 year rearrest recidivism outcome:

Example #1:
Risk Factors: The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 240 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 4. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

Example #2:
Risk Factors: The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. Respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
